question: Which country has the longest coastline on the Mediterranean Basin?
explanation: Greece has the longest coastline on the Mediterranean Basin. Greece, officially the Hellenic Republic, is a country located in Southeast Europe. Athens is it's largest and capital city. Situated on the southern tip of the Balkans, Greece is located at the crossroads of Europe, Asia, and Africa. It shares land borders with Albania to the northwest, North Macedonia and Bulgaria to the north, and Turkey to the northeast. The Aegean Sea lies to the east of the mainland, the Ionian Sea to the west, the Cretan Sea and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Greece has the longest coastline on the Mediterranean Basin and the 11th longest coastline in the world at 13,676 km (8,498 mi) in length.
